channel.title: Firefox is fucked
channel.description: Firefox is fucking up for me.... What firefox is doing? - When I right click, it comes up with spelling corrections of the word constitution... Even if its on a link.. - When I visit sites such as ebay.com, it sends me to a ebay phisher. - When I sometimes click URLs off a google search, it redirects me to a advertisement... - Firefox also keeps crashing quite a lot, even when I am not on YouTube or anything that should overload firefox, just have a few threads of Moparscape open :L.. Any ideas? Should I switch browsers? If I should switch browser, what should I switch to? Please reply as it is a frustrating problem.

item.title: Firefox is fucked
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If you’re having problems with Firefox, press alt, go to help, click troubleshooting information then on the right side click the “reset Firefox” button.

Chances are if you’re having problems with Firefox it’s because of some toolbar, search engine or addon.

Read full topic

I had the rightclick problem a few days ago. Just reinstall.

item.title: Firefox is fucked
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

use ie9 or chrome
inb4 ‘ie9 sucks dick’

yeah because that solves the problem of malicious malware…

run combofix http://www.google.com.hk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=3&ved=0CGIQFjAC&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.bleepingcomputer.com%2Fdownload%2Fcombofix%2F&ei=qLgDUI0GxtiKB-q8pYgI&usg=AFQjCNHkPNcIR0NKZdnds9Tmpf2EF1zxBQ

Someone suggested to me that it was a dodgy add-on I have installed, but I only have the Lightshot plugin installed, nothing else…
So do you think its a malware problem? I downloaded that program you sent

EDIT: This program looks SO dodgy LOL
[/quote]

Sure does sound phishy to me. Heh, get it? Phishy.[/quote]
Boo.

item.title: Firefox is fucked
item.dc:creator: @Mee0345 Mee0345
item.description:
@Mee0345 wrote:

Firefox is fucking up for me…
What firefox is doing?

  • When I right click, it comes up with spelling corrections of the word constitution… Even if its on a link…
  • When I visit sites such as ebay.com, it sends me to a ebay phisher.
  • When I sometimes click URLs off a google search, it redirects me to a advertisement…
  • Firefox also keeps crashing quite a lot, even when I am not on YouTube or anything that should overload firefox, just have a few threads of Moparscape open :L…
    Any ideas? Should I switch browsers? If I should switch browser, what should I switch to?
    Please reply as it is a frustrating problem.

Read full topic
